intro: Chaetanthera lanigera, commonly known as the woolly false lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. Chaetanthera lanigera is typically found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
